meanings.definition: Transfer from public to private ownership or control.
meanings.sent1: The government privatises some services to companies.
meanings.sent2: She privatises her business to focus on quality.
meanings.sent3: The magician privatises his tricks to keep them secret.
meanings.sent4: The sun privatises the sky with its warm rays.
meanings.sent5: He privatises his thoughts, keeping them to himself.

meanings.definition: Cause to become private or non-public.
meanings.sent1: They privatises the information for security reasons.
meanings.sent2: The company privatises its data to protect customer privacy.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel privatises its acorn stash from other animals.
meanings.sent4: Her smile privatises her happiness, hiding her true feelings.
meanings.sent5: The lock privatises the contents of the box, keeping them safe.
